meanings.definition: A person who lives a solitary life and avoids contact with others.
meanings.sent1: Some recluses prefer spending time alone in nature.
meanings.sent2: The old man down the street is known as one of the neighborhood recluses.
meanings.sent3: The recluses at the library always seem to find the quietest corners to read in.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling city, the park felt like a sanctuary for the recluses seeking peace.
meanings.sent5: The recluses in the mountains were content with their own company and the beauty of the landscape.

meanings.definition: To shut oneself away from the world.
meanings.sent1: She recluses herself in her room whenever she needs time to think.
meanings.sent2: After a long day at work, he just wants to recluse in front of the TV.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to recluses under the bed during the thunderstorm.
meanings.sent4: As the storm raged outside, she felt the need to recluses from the chaos.
meanings.sent5: The author would often recluses in a cabin in the woods to focus on writing.
